title: How to Make a Russian Apple Cake

steps.headline: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees/ 180 degrees Celsius.
Melt the butter in the microwave and let it cool (but not congeal).
steps.description: Scoop some butter into a small microwave safe bowl. Microwave it for 30 seconds to a minute. Microwave it for longer depending on the type of microwave you have.

steps.headline: Break the eggs into a bowl and mix well.
steps.description: Tap the egg gently against the side of the bowl and crack it open. Using a wooden stick stir the egg.

steps.headline: Add the butter to the mix.
steps.description: Pour the melted butter into the egg. Mix it up.

steps.headline: Add in flour.
steps.description: Gradually pour in flour to the bowl. Stir while pouring in the flour.

steps.headline: Add the sugar.
steps.description: Pour the sugar in gradually and continue to stir while doing so.

steps.headline: Stir until there are no lumps of sugar, butter or flour left.
steps.description: Use an electric mixer if you're having trouble with lumps.

steps.headline: Combine baking soda and vinegar.
steps.description: Add the baking soda and pour the vinegar directly onto the baking soda to neutralize it. Fizzing should occur when you do this.

steps.headline: Add a pinch of salt this will help to enhance the flavour.
Mix well so that the mix is even.
Add the apples to the pan.
steps.description: Butter up the pan to prevent sticking. Place apple slices in small portions so that they don't scuff up the flour. Place the apple slices  on the bottom of the pan.

steps.headline: Spread the apples out evenly.
steps.description: Try not to stack a lot of apples on top of each other so it will bake evenly.

steps.headline: Pour the mix onto the apples.
steps.description: Pour the mixture slowly over the apples and make sure there is an even distribution of dough.

steps.headline: Place the pan onto the lowest rung of the oven.
Bake for 30 minutes.
steps.description: Clean the dirty dishes from earlier to kill time.

steps.headline: Check if the cake is cooked properly.
steps.description: Stick a fork or a knife into the cake and remove the knife. Cook the cake for longer If there is any residue on the fork or knife, keep cooking

steps.headline: Remove the cake when the top is a nice light golden brown.
steps.description: Use oven mits to remove the cake and serve immediately.

text: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees/ 180 degrees Celsius.  Melt the butter in the microwave and let it cool (but not congeal). Scoop some butter into a small microwave safe bowl. Microwave it for 30 seconds to a minute. Microwave it for longer depending on the type of microwave you have. Break the eggs into a bowl and mix well. Tap the egg gently against the side of the bowl and crack it open. Using a wooden stick stir the egg. Add the butter to the mix. Pour the melted butter into the egg. Mix it up. Add in flour. Gradually pour in flour to the bowl. Stir while pouring in the flour. Add the sugar. Pour the sugar in gradually and continue to stir while doing so. Stir until there are no lumps of sugar, butter or flour left. Use an electric mixer if you're having trouble with lumps. Combine baking soda and vinegar. Add the baking soda and pour the vinegar directly onto the baking soda to neutralize it. Fizzing should occur when you do this. Add a pinch of salt this will help to enhance the flavour.  Mix well so that the mix is even.  Add the apples to the pan. Butter up the pan to prevent sticking. Place apple slices in small portions so that they don't scuff up the flour. Place the apple slices  on the bottom of the pan. Spread the apples out evenly. Try not to stack a lot of apples on top of each other so it will bake evenly. Pour the mix onto the apples. Pour the mixture slowly over the apples and make sure there is an even distribution of dough. Place the pan onto the lowest rung of the oven.  Bake for 30 minutes. Clean the dirty dishes from earlier to kill time. Check if the cake is cooked properly. Stick a fork or a knife into the cake and remove the knife. Cook the cake for longer If there is any residue on the fork or knife, keep cooking Remove the cake when the top is a nice light golden brown. Use oven mits to remove the cake and serve immediately. Finished.
